alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Crawford County through 715 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pymatuning North to 11 miles south of Meadville. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Meadville, Linesville, Harmonsburg, Guys Mills, Pymatuning North, Pymatuning Central, Cochranton, Saegertown, Conneautville, Conneaut Lake, Blooming Valley, Townville, Venango, Woodcock, Conneaut Lakeshore and Geneva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
